noun.description: An official inspection of an individual's or organization's accounts, typically by an independent body.

verb.description: Conduct an official financial examination of (an individual's or organization's accounts)
examples: companies must have their accounts audited
synonyms: go over with a fine-tooth comb

verb.description: Attend (a class) informally, not for academic credit.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin auditus hearing, from audire hear, in medieval Latin auditus (compoti) audit (of an account), an audit originally being presented orally.
